subject: Philosophy
title: Climate Justice
description: A short lesson to help you apply Climate Justice.

hook.text: Rich nations caused climate change. Poor nations suffer its worst effects. How is that just?

buildup.text: Climate justice asks: who should bear the cost of fixing what industrialized countries broke?

discovery.text: The polluter-pays principle seems fair. But applying it between nations is politically explosive.

twist.text: Future generations will bear the brunt. They have no vote, no voice, and no say in today's decisions.

climax.text: Climate change forces political philosophy to think beyond borders and beyond the present moment.

punchline.text: The biggest injustice hits those who didn't cause it.

quiz.question: What does climate justice demand?
options: Those most responsible for emissions should bear the cost of fixing them
Climate change is not a justice issue
